title: Endor Labs raises $93M to secure AI-generated code from vulnerabilities
content: Endor Labs Inc. raised $93 million in Series B funding to secure AI-generated code from vulnerabilities. The funding round was led by DFJ Growth, with participation from new investor Salesforce Ventures and existing backers.
summary: Endor Labs Inc. raised $93 million in Series B funding to secure AI-generated code from vulnerabilities. The funding round was led by DFJ Growth, with participation from new investor Salesforce Ventures and existing backers.

title: OpenAI Acquires Windsurf for $3 Billion in Major AI Coding Consolidation
content: OpenAI has completed its acquisition of Windsurf (formerly Codeium) for approximately $3 billion, marking one of the largest AI coding tool acquisitions and validating the agentic IDE market.
summary: OpenAI has completed its acquisition of Windsurf (formerly Codeium) for approximately $3 billion, marking one of the largest AI coding tool acquisitions and validating the agentic IDE market.

title: ChatGPT can now reference all past conversations â€“ April 10, 2025
content: OpenAI has updated ChatGPT to include a new memory feature that allows it to reference all past conversations automatically. This feature includes semantically-relevant chat items from the past.
summary: OpenAI has updated ChatGPT to include a new memory feature that allows it to reference all past conversations automatically. This feature includes semantically-relevant chat items from the past.

title: GitHub Copilot Adds Multi-Model Support
content: GitHub Copilot now supports multiple AI models including Claude 3.7, o3-mini, and Gemini Flash 2.0, giving developers choice in their AI assistance.
summary: GitHub Copilot now supports multiple AI models including Claude 3.7, o3-mini, and Gemini Flash 2.0, giving developers choice in their AI assistance....

title: Devin, the viral coding AI agent, gets a new pay-as-you-go plan
content: Cognition introduced a new low-cost plan for Devin, its AI coding tool. The plan offers a $20 entry-level option with pay-as-you-go pricing, aimed at incentivizing more users to try the AI programming assistant.
summary: Cognition introduced a new low-cost plan for Devin, its AI coding tool. The plan offers a $20 entry-level option with pay-as-you-go pricing, aimed at incentivizing more users to try the AI programming assistant.
